metadata.synopsis: COM when the players approach Elminster with Gale, or dialogue that triggers if Gale is in camp when Elminster is approached by an Avatar.Elminster does a brief introduction before joining the camp, potentially taking the players along.Can trigger in either Creche or SCL.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Give Gale at least one magic item, go to SCL_Main_A, and approach Elminster at S_ORI_Gale_ElminsterPoint_SCL_975ef355-b68e-4061-bda8-b774e8ff552fOR- Give Gale at least one magic item, go to CRE_Main_A, and approach Elminster at S_ORI_Gale_ElminsterPoint_CRE_f5a225ef-d123-449f-98e2-53309a21979b

34.speaker: Weary Traveller
34.text: May I inquire if perchance you retain among your travelling companions a man who adheres to the given name of Gale?
34.context:
InternalNodeContext: User and dialog flag - Elminster only remembers the denied al according the the Dialog flag.
The user flag is here to avoid him addressing other members of the same party.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: As a matter of fact, I do. He's resting in camp.
9.context:
InternalNodeContext: User and dialog flag - Elminster only remembers the denied al according the the Dialog flag.
The user flag is here to avoid him addressing other members of the same party.

4.speaker: Weary Traveller
4.text: Ever a man of leisure. Would it pain you greatly to assist me along the little voyage I intend to undertake to this aforementioned camp?

3.speaker: Weary Traveller
3.text: And I would confirm it to be so. Please, after you.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'd like to know first who I'd be bringing to see Gale.

5.speaker: Weary Traveller
5.text: Now, if this answer satisfies you, let us linger no longer in this limbo of indecision, but set course for your camp forthwith.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Elminster Aumar! Yes of course, it would be my honour.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Very well. Let's go see Gale then.

69.speaker: Weary Traveller
69.text: A splendid notion! Please, after you.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I'm sure you'll have no trouble finding our camp without my assistance. I'll see you there later.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I'm sure you'll have no trouble finding our camp without my assistance. I'll see you there later.

51.speaker: Weary Traveller
51.text: Though I'd have welcomed a voice other than my own to entertain me along my weary way, I shall take your answer in stride and with it, take my leave as well.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: May I inquire who is inquiring?
52.context:
InternalNodeContext: User and dialog flag - Elminster only remembers the denied al according the the Dialog flag.
The user flag is here to avoid him addressing other members of the same party.

13.speaker: Weary Traveller
13.text: Should it be the nature of our acquaintance that interests you, you may safely classify Gale and I as friends.

79.speaker: Weary Traveller
79.text: Should it be the nature of your present interlocutor that you desire to drag from the darkened unknown, I shall be glad to aid in your quest for illumination and identify myself as Elminster. Elminster Aumar.

8.speaker: Weary Traveller
8.text: Now, if this answer satisfies you, let us linger no longer in this limbo of indecision, but settle on your knowledge of the individual I seek.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: It's a great honour to meet you, Elminster! I do know Gale, yes. He's in our camp at the moment.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I do know Gale, yes. He's in our camp at the moment.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'm afraid I must settle it in the negative: I do not know Gale.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Gale, you say? Never heard of him.
60.context:
InternalNodeContext: User and dialog flag - Elminster only remembers the denied al according the the Dialog flag.
The user flag is here to avoid him addressing other members of the same party.

72.speaker: Weary Traveller
72.text: Even though I suspect your denial soils rather than sustains the splendid dominion that is the truth, I shall take your answer in stride and with it, take my leave as well.
72.context:
InternalNodeContext: User and dialog flag - Elminster only remembers the denied al according the the Dialog flag.
The user flag is here to avoid him addressing other members of the same party.

45.speaker: Weary Traveller
45.context:
InternalNodeContext: User and dialog flag - Elminster only remembers the denied al according the the Dialog flag.
The user flag is here to avoid him addressing other members of the same party.

33.speaker: Weary Traveller
33.text: Ho there, wanderer. Stay thy course a moment to indulge an old man.
33.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

39.speaker: Gale
39.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

17.speaker: Weary Traveller
17.text: The very same, Gale. And a fair bit miffed he is, too, finding himself forced to expose his best pair of boots to so many miles of country road on your behalf.
17.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Elminster Aumar, the very pinnacle of wizardry. It's an honour, sir.
11.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

12.speaker: Weary Traveller
12.text: Endure an hour's worth of exposition to my presence, and you may well come to consider a different sort of honorific with which to chronicle the occasion, but until then, your sentiment is well-received.
12.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: Yes, yes, yes, be that as it may, you said you came all this way on my behalf, did you not? For what purpose?
29.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

61.speaker: Weary Traveller
61.text: I was bid to spare neither time nor my own self to find you. She sent me, Gale. You know of whom I speak.
61.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: But why? Out with it, Elminster. Please!
24.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

78.speaker: Weary Traveller
78.text: Young man, has your sojourn away from Waterdeep washed away your decorum as well as your patience?
78.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

75.speaker: Weary Traveller
75.text: Nigh a tenday I've gone without honest fare worthy of the name - drank naught but what the sky entitled my thirst.
75.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

1.speaker: Weary Traveller
1.text: Why, some bread, cheese, and a cup of wine would appear unto me a feast! Surely you won't begrudge me a mite of rest and repast before I get 'out with it'?
1.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Yes, Gale. Where is your decorum?
67.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

28.speaker: Gale
28.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

71.speaker: Weary Traveller
71.text: This way, then, hmmm, to your camp? Don't dawdle now, lad. You're the one who's in such a frightful hurry.
71.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: Nigh on thirteen centuries old and he still thinks with his stomach. We'd best follow, and see if he's more disposed to speak plainly once it's stopped its grumbling.
16.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Very well. I suppose I'm as curious as you are to hear what he has to say.

44.speaker: Gale
44.text: A wise choice. Better to indulge our curiosity than Elminster's appetite.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: We'll meet him in camp later. Let him have his rest and repast in the meantime.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Surely you could have conjured any feast you liked.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.NodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.

20.speaker: Weary Traveller
20.text: Alas, such luxuries require the beneficence of time, and time, as I'm sure our friend here will attest, is the very luxury of which we're all too bereft.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I suppose we could part with a few of our rations.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.NodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.

68.speaker: Weary Traveller
68.text: And a great kindness that would be! See, Gale? Even in these barren parts, the art of hospitality begets inspired new works if one only keeps up the practice.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'm not in the habit of taking in vagabonds.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.NodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.

40.speaker: Weary Traveller
40.text: Oh? And what is he, then, wandering these forlorn barrens over seven hundred miles from home?
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.NodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Elminster Aumar, favoured like none other by exalted Mystra. It's an honour, sir.
25.context: NodeContext: He doesn’t say this in anger, but in utter shock and surprise that the player would venture to insult the famed Elminster.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: My, not every day one meets the hero of countless ballads in the flesh.
36.context: NodeContext: He doesn’t say this in anger, but in utter shock and surprise that the player would venture to insult the famed Elminster.

15.speaker: Weary Traveller
15.text: I know a minstrel by trade when I see one! Tell me, what ballad bold enough to lift me unto the pedestal of acclaim enjoys your musical predilection?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: The Day the Dragon Woke in Flame, Elminster Hailed the Wyrm King's Heir.

80.speaker: Weary Traveller
80.text: Ha! Old, but hearty, and rife with witty flourishes - not unlike myself. I confess it to be among my favoured few as well.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Ten Leagues Into the Underdark, the Wizard Bore the Lance of Krynn.

66.speaker: Weary Traveller
66.text: Ah, yes, and a fine melody it is too. Its verses fail to mention however, the sheer weight of that monstrous lance.

22.speaker: Weary Traveller
22.text: Why, but one league down, and such was the extent of my perspirations that my hat could have doubled as an aquarium.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Across the Peaks of Icewind Dale, Strode Fast the Sage of Shadowdale.

54.speaker: Weary Traveller
54.text: Is that so? The lyrics are by Volo, you know, whose name alone is sufficient enough a criterion to arbitrate its acclaim to truth.

35.speaker: Weary Traveller
35.text: Two weeks I had to endure a frozen beard and wicked frostbites, yet he makes it sound like a dalliance through the Dales.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I think some proper introductions are in order.
31.context: NodeContext: He doesn’t say this in anger, but in utter shock and surprise that the player would venture to insult the famed Elminster.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: Meet Elminster Aumar. A good friend of mine, but rather more significantly, he's the most famed and respected wizard in the realms.

37.speaker: Weary Traveller
37.text: Am I, indeed? Most famed and respected errand boy, more like.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Many miles, you say. Where do you hail from?
41.context: NodeContext: He doesn’t say this in anger, but in utter shock and surprise that the player would venture to insult the famed Elminster.

59.speaker: Gale
59.text: Originally? Shadowdale. Lately? The fanciest inns of Waterdeep.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Hit that country road, old man. I'm not interested in the junk you sell or the junk you tell.
6.context: NodeContext: He doesn’t say this in anger, but in utter shock and surprise that the player would venture to insult the famed Elminster.

55.speaker: Gale
55.context: NodeContext: He doesn’t say this in anger, but in utter shock and surprise that the player would venture to insult the famed Elminster.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: This is Elminster Aumar, the most famed and respected wizard in the realms!
